gameutils
Class Game

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Panel
              java.applet.Applet
                  gameutils.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Runnable, Accessible
public abstract class Game
extends Applet
implements Runnable

Game is the main class that must be extended by the user. It handles the game loop and certain other functions.
Game extends Applet but also supports being a desktop app.
Remember: if this game will be used as an Applet, a default constructor MUST be present.

It uses a Screen system where only 1 Screen is active at one time.

A typical game looks like this:

public class MyGame extends Game {
    public static void main(String args[]) {
        MyGame game = new MyGame();
        game.setupFrame("My Game",800,600,true);
        game.start();
    }

    public void initGame() {
        //Initialize the game
    }

    public void update(long deltaTime) {
        //Update the game
    }

    public void paused() {
        //Pause the game
    }

    public void resumed() {
        //Resume the game
    }

    public void resized(int width, int height) {
        //Resize the game
    }

    public void stopGame() {
        //Stop the game
    }

    public void paint(Graphics2D g) {
        //Draw the game
    }
}

Author:
Roi Atalla

Constructor Detail

Game

public Game()
Default constructor. The defaults are:
- 60FPS
- Version 1.0
- showFPS = true
- quality = high
- standardKeysEnabled = true

Game

public Game(int FPS,
            double version)
Sets defaults and the FPS and version.

Parameters:
FPS - The FPS to achieve.
version - The version of this game.

getRootParent

public Container getRootParent()
Returns the appropriate container of this game: this instance if it is an Applet, the JFrame if it is a desktop application.

Returns:
If this game is an Applet, it returns this instance, else it returns the JFrame used to display this game.

Returns true if the game loop is paused.

Returns:

resume

public void resume()
Manually resumes the game loop. resumed() will be called right before the game loop resumes.

stop

public final void stop()
Called when this game is stopped. Calling this method stops the game loop. This method then calls stopGame().

Overrides:
stop in class Applet

g - The Graphics context to be used to draw to the canvas.

showFPS

public void showFPS(boolean showFPS)
Sets the showFPS property.

Parameters:
showFPS - If true, the FPS is updated and displayed every second, else the FPS is not displayed.

Returns the current state of the showFPS property.

If true, the FPS is updated and displayed every second, else the FPS is not displayed.

Sets the optimal FPS of this game.

Parameters:
FPS - Specifies the number of updates and frames shown per second.

setHighQuality

Sets the quality of this game's graphics.

Parameters:
highQuality - If true, the graphics are of high quality, else the graphics are of low quality.

public boolean isHighQuality()
Returns the current state of the quality property.

Returns:
If true, the graphics are of high quality, else the graphics are of low quality.

setStandardKeysEnabled

public void setStandardKeysEnabled(boolean standardKeysEnabled)
The standard keys are M for audio on/off, P for pause/resume, and Q for high/low quality.

Parameters:
standardKeysEnabled - If true, a key press of the standard keys automatically call the appropriate methods, else this function is disabled.

isStandardKeysEnabled

public boolean isStandardKeysEnabled()
Returns the current state of the standardKeysEnabled property.

Returns:
If true, a key press of the standard keys automatically call the appropriate methods, else this function is disabled.
